Fri, 29 Nov 2024 19:31:36 -0800 (PST) MIME-Version: 1.0 References: In-Reply-To: From: Evan Smith Date: Fri, 29 Nov 2024 19:31:24 -0800 Message-ID: Subject: Fwd: Trump Charges Dismissed, Israel-Hezbollah Ceasefire, and Pardoned Turkeys To: inbound@news.foo.com Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="000000000000e53af3062818f384" --000000000000e53af3062818f384 Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8" Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Facts, without motives. [image: beacon] View email in browser . *In partnership with* *Good morning. It's Tuesday, Nov. 26,* and we're covering dropped charges against President-elect Donald Trump, a proposed Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire deal, and much more. First time reading? Join over 4 million intellectually curious readers. *Sign up here * . *Don=E2=80=99t keep us a secret*: *Share the email * with friends (*copy URL here * ) And, as always, send us feedback at *hello@join1440.com *. Need To Know Need To Know Trump Charges Dropped The judge overseeing the Jan. 6 election interference case against President-elect Donald Trump dropped charges yesterday, following a request from Special Counsel Jack Smith. Smith similarly moved to dismiss charges against Trump, accusing him of illegally retaining classified documents after leaving office. In filings (read here ), Smith said his view of the case remained unchanged but cited the Justice Department's long-standing legal perspective that federal prosecution of a sitting president is unconstitutional. In the election interference case, prosecutors alleged Trump conspired to interfere with the 2020 election and obstruct the official certification of electoral votes (see previous write-up ). Charges were brought last August, with the trial delayed by a legal challenge in which the Supreme Court ultimately ruled former presidents hav= e some immunity to criminal prosecution for acts in office. Smith subsequently refiled updated charges 10 weeks ahead of the election. In related news, the president-elect said yesterday evening he would look to impose 25% tariffs on all goods coming from Canada and Mexico and additional tariffs on Chinese goods on his first day back in office. Israel Weighs Hezbollah Deal Israel's Cabinet is expected to vote today on the terms of a proposed cease= fire deal with Hezbollah in Lebanon. The deal=E2=80=94which does not cover the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza=E2=80=94= would reportedly include a 60-day Israeli withdrawal from southern Lebanon as Hezbollah fighters move north of the Litani River (see map ). The Lebanese army would monitor the border in a process overseen by five countries, led by the US and France. Israel could continue to take military action to disrupt Hezbollah's ability to smuggle weapons and reestablish a border presence. Hezbollah renewed its conflict with Israel on Oct. 8, 2023, launching thousands of rockets into the country following Hamas' Oct. 7 attacks. Since then, around 60,000 people have been displaced in Israel and more than 1 million people in Lebanon. Israeli attacks in Lebanon=E2=80=94including a ground invasion this year=E2=80=94have killed m= ore than 3,500 people and wounded over 15,000 others; Hezbollah attacks have killed around 140 people in Israel. Dancing in the Mini Moonlight Earth=E2=80=99s temporary =E2=80=9Cmini moon,=E2=80=9D a 33-foot asteroid known as 2024 PT5, is departing after spending two months near our planet. The space rock began its horseshoe-shaped path around Earth in late September but was never fully captured as a true satellite. Scientists believe the bus-sized rock may be a chunk of our own moon based on its composition and characteristics, finding its makeup closely matches lunar samples collected by Russian and NASA missions in the past. The asteroid's spectral characteristics resemble material from the moon's maria regions =E2=80=94dark lunar areas formed by ancient lava flows=E2=80=94suggesting it may have bee= n ejected from a lunar crater millions of years ago. The asteroid will make a brief reappearance in January, passing within 1.1 million miles of our planet=E2=80=94about five times the distance from Eart= h to the moon. After the flyby, it won't return until 2055. *In partnership with Babbel* Learn A New Language, See the World Henry Ford said, =E2=80=9CAnyone who stops learning is old, at 20 or 80. An= yone who keeps learning stays young.=E2=80=9D What better way to *continue educating yourself* than by exploring the world. If you=E2=80=99re worried about the language barrie= r=E2=80=94meet Babbel. Babbel helps you *start speaking a new language* in just *three weeks*. Seriously. Things have changed a bit since the days of flashcards and vocab quizzes. Designed by 150 linguists, Babbel uses podcasts, games, live online classes, and other proven methods to *make you conversational quickly* . Plus, get pronunciation tips and cultural context for each of the 14 languages offered. Don=E2=80=99t wait for the perfect time or the perfect trip=E2=80=94*start = learning today* and you=E2=80=99ll run out of reasons to push that vacation off for another yea= r. figures expected Dec. 11 (More ) | *Kohl's CEO* to be replaced by Michaels CEO in January; transition marks company's third leadership change since 2018 (More ) *>* *Blackstone invests $3.5B* in US natural gas company EQT, gaining minority stakes in Mid-Atlantic pipelines expected to see a surge in demand amid expected growth of data centers powering AI (More ) *=F0=9F=93=88 **1440 Business & Finance: *This week, we have a Thanksgiving= Day special, exploring how Macy's became a cultural icon=E2=80=94and launched i= ts famous holiday parade. Smith subsequently ref= iled updated charges 10 weeks ahead of the election.=C2=A0 =C2=A0 In related news, the president-elect = said yesterday evening he would look to <a href=3D"https://link.join1440.co= m/click/37615905.4674886/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvdHJ1bXAtdGFyaW= Zmcy1jYW5hZGEtbWV4aWNvLWNoaW5hLTU5MjM5YWZlMTIwMzNjYTk5YzY1YzdhMmJlMGU0ZjBk/= 67456a0c2f068d0b710a8397B82a35abc" style=3D"text-decoration:underline!impor= tant;color:rgb(0,0,238)!important" target=3D"_blank">impose 25% tariffs</a> on all goods coming from Canada = and Mexico and additional tariffs on Chinese goods on his first day back in= office.=C2=A0 =C2=A0 Is= rael Weighs Hezbollah Deal Israel&#39;s Cabinet is=C2=A0expected to vote today on the= terms of a proposed=C2=A0<a href=3D"https://link.join1440.com/click/376159= 05.4674886/aHR0cHM6Ly90aGVoaWxsLmNvbS9wb2xpY3kvZGVmZW5zZS81MDA4MTY5LWNlYXNl= ZmlyZS1kZWFsLWlzcmFlbC1oZXpib2xsYWgv/67456a0c2f068d0b710a8397B81820f07" sty= le=3D"text-decoration:underline!important;color:rgb(0,0,238)!important" tar= get=3D"_blank">ceasefire deal</a>= with Hezbollah in Lebanon. =C2=A0 The deal=E2=80=94which does not cover the Israel-Hamas = war in Gaza=E2=80=94would reportedly include a 60-day Israeli withdrawal fr= om southern Lebanon as Hezbollah fighters move north of the Litani River (see m= ap</a>). The Lebanese army would monitor the border in a process ove= rseen by five countries, led by the US and France. Israel could continue to= take military action to disrupt Hezbollah&#39;s ability to smuggle weapons= and reestablish a border presence. =C2=A0 Hezbollah renewed its <a href=3D"http= s://link.join1440.com/click/37615905.4674886/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY2ZyLm9yZy9iYW= NrZ3JvdW5kZXIvd2hhdC1oZXpib2xsYWg/67456a0c2f068d0b710a8397B6a6c0dbd" style= =3D"text-decoration:underline!important;color:rgb(0,0,238)!important" targe= t=3D"_blank">conflict with Israel= </a> on Oct. 8, 2023, launching thousands of rockets into the country follo= wing Hamas&#39; Oct. 7 attacks. Since then, around 60,000 people have been = displaced in Israel and more than 1 million people in Lebanon. Israeli atta= cks in Lebanon=E2=80=94including a ground invasion this year=E2=80=94have k= illed more than 3,500 people and wounded over 15,000 others; Hezbollah atta= cks have killed around 140 people in Israel. =C2=A0 Da= ncing in the Mini Moonlight Earth=E2=80=99s temporary <a href=3D"https://link.join1440= .com/click/37615905.4674886/aHR0cHM6Ly9hcG5ld3MuY29tL2FydGljbGUvZWFydGgtbWl= uaS1tb29uLWFkZmIyMmZhODJhMDFkMTY4YzFiNjYzYWNmMTBlYjky/67456a0c2f068d0b710a8= 397B06f7d11a" style=3D"text-decoration:underline!important;color:rgb(0,0,23= 8)!important" target=3D"_blank">=E2=80= =9Cmini moon,=E2=80=9D</a> a 33-foot asteroid known as 2024 PT5, is = departing after spending two months near our planet. The space rock began i= ts horseshoe-shaped path around Earth in late September but was never fully= captured as a true satellite. =C2=A0 Scientists believe the bus-sized rock may be a chunk of= our <a href=3D"https://link.join1440.com/click/37615905.4674886/aHR0cHM6Ly= 93d3cubGl2ZXNjaWVuY2UuY29tL3NwYWNlL2FzdGVyb2lkcy9lYXJ0aHMtbGF0ZXN0LW1pbmltb= 29uLWNvdWxkLWJlLWEtY2h1bmstb2Ytb3VyLXBsYW5ldHMtcGVybWFuZW50LW1vb24tYW5kLWl0= cy1hYm91dC10by1sZWF2ZS11cy1iZWhpbmQ/67456a0c2f068d0b710a8397Bf29edb47" styl= e=3D"text-decoration:underline!important;color:rgb(0,0,238)!important" targ= et=3D"_blank">own moon</a>=C2=A0b= ased on its composition and characteristics, finding its makeup closely mat= ches lunar samples collected by Russian and NASA missions in the past. The = asteroid&#39;s spectral characteristics resemble material from the moon&#39= ;s <a href=3D"https://link.join1440.com/click/37615905.4674886/aHR0cHM6Ly9t= YXNoYWJsZS5jb20vYXJ0aWNsZS9mYXItc2lkZS1kYXJrLW1vb24tZXhwbGFpbmVk/67456a0c2f= 068d0b710a8397Bee6732e1" style=3D"text-decoration:underline!important;color= :rgb(0,0,238)!important" target=3D"_blank">maria regions</a>=E2=80=94dark lunar areas formed by ancient lava= flows=E2=80=94suggesting it may have been ejected from a lunar crater mill= ions of years ago. =C2=A0 The asteroid will make a brief reappe= arance in January, passing within 1.1 million miles of our planet=E2=80=94a= bout five times the distance from Earth to the moon. After the flyby, it wo= n&#39;t return until 2055.
